title: Amazon preparing for another round of layoffs, thousands of jobs under scanner
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO on the mistakes that still trouble him after 20 years of career
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon identified slow decision-making as his most significant career regret, emphasizing that "inertia has become an unforgivable sin" in today's rapidly evolving landscape. He highlighted the bank's aggressive AI adoption as a response to this urgency and the threat posed by agile fintech competitors.

title: Couple found dead in Ahmedabad flat: Congress MP’s nephew ‘accidentally’ shoots wife
content: Tragedy struck in Ahmedabad as Yashrajsinh Gohil, nephew of a Rajya Sabha MP, allegedly shot his wife Rajeshwari with his licensed revolver before taking his own life. The couple, married for two months, had returned from a social event. Police are investigating the sequence of events, with initial findings suggesting accidental firing followed by suicide.

title: Ex-India cricketer calls for Shubman Gill's removal as ODI captain
content: Former India batter Manoj Tiwary advocates for Rohit Sharma's immediate return as ODI captain, citing Shubman Gill's recent struggles. Tiwary believes Rohit's proven leadership is crucial for the upcoming World Cup, suggesting a significantly higher chance of victory under his command compared to Gill's. He questioned the timing of the captaincy change.

title: Sam Altman is not happy with what everyone thinks of OpenAI and ChatGPT
content: OpenAI's API business has achieved over $1 billion in annual recurring revenue in the past month, signaling strong developer and enterprise adoption. This growth occurs as investors express concerns about the AI company's long-term financial sustainability and face increasing competition from rivals like Google's Gemini, which has seen significant user growth.

title: Pills, pillow, porn: How Andhra woman used 'biryani' to kill husband
content: A woman in Andhra Pradesh allegedly murdered her husband with her boyfriend's assistance by drugging his biryani and then suffocating him. She later claimed he died of a heart attack, but injuries and a post-mortem confirmed suffocation. Both have been detained by police.

title: Last time Bangladesh was involved in an ICC event row, it led to a team replacement
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has refused to send its team to the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 in India, citing a lack of justice from the ICC. The global governing body rejected Bangladesh's venue shift request and has issued an ultimatum. Scotland is now the frontrunner to replace Bangladesh in the tournament.

title: 'Speeding' car crushes 5-year-old to death in Pune; CCTV video emerges
content: Tragedy struck Joy Nest Society as five-year-old Nikash Reddy was fatally struck by a speeding car while playing. New CCTV footage reveals the horrifying moments leading up to the accident. The driver, who had entered the society to drop off a friend, immediately rushed the boy to the hospital, but he was pronounced dead on arrival.

title: Bomb threat emails keep hitting schools: Delhi NCR’s hoax wave and how it spread in 2025
content: Delhi NCR has emerged as the epicentre of a nationwide wave of bomb threat hoaxes targeting schools and colleges through 2025 and early 2026. Hundreds of institutions were forced to evacuate following anonymous email threats, triggering large-scale police and emergency responses. While investigations across states consistently found no explosives, the alerts spread beyond the capital to cities such as Bengaluru, Mumbai, Jaipur and Ahmedabad, revealing coordinated patterns and significant operational strain on authorities.

title: Verdict reserved in certification dispute: Madras HC to rule on 'Jana Nayagan'; judgment due
content: The Madras High Court has reserved its verdict on the censor row for actor Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan,' with a decision expected on January 27. The case involves a dispute over the film's certification, with the CBFC appealing a single judge's order for a U/A 16+ rating. The outcome will determine the film's release.

title: T20 WC drama: 'If Bangladesh don't play, it won't matter; if Pakistan refuse ... '
content: Former Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria backed the ICC's decision to maintain the 2026 T20 World Cup schedule in India, dismissing Bangladesh's security concerns. He stated Bangladesh's absence would have minimal impact, highlighting that political issues are overshadowing cricket discussions and urging for the sport to remain separate from politics.

title: A life rewritten, not defeated: The story of 38-year old that raises questions
content: Anuj Arora, diagnosed with multiple sclerosis at 26, navigates life's profound challenges with remarkable grace. Despite physical limitations, he finds renewed purpose through technology, enabling laptop use. His story highlights some compelling questions that we as a socity should be ready to answer.

title: Magic Johnson celebrates Cookie Johnson’s 67th birthday with heartfelt message
content: Magic Johnson celebrated his wife Cookie Johnson's 67th birthday with a heartfelt social media message and a montage of photos. The post highlighted their enduring partnership of over 40 years, their shared faith, and Cookie's significant contributions as an entrepreneur and philanthropist. Their love story, which began in college, continues to inspire fans.

title: 'Museum of failures': Harvard MBA and ex-JP Morgan analyst shares hard career lessons
content: Grace Lee, a Harvard Business School graduate, shared her "museum of failures" on Instagram, detailing career struggles, a late ADHD diagnosis, and the toll of hustle culture. Her candid reflection on setbacks and health challenges offers a relatable perspective for young professionals, emphasizing that ambition doesn't always guarantee success and highlighting the importance of well-being.

title: 'Why are you so afraid?' SC rejects privacy plea, allows ED to access I-PAC man’s phone
content: The Supreme Court has refused to stop the ED from accessing data from an I-PAC functionary's seized mobile phone. The court questioned the plea to protect privacy, stating it knows how to safeguard innocent citizens. This comes as the ED faces challenges accessing digital devices in other money laundering cases.

title: Clash breaks out near MP's Ujjain: 11 buses vandalised, shops damaged
content: A clash erupted in Tarana town, Ujjain, leaving six injured after a dispute led to vandalism of buses and shops. Eyewitnesses reported a group beat up two individuals, one linked to a Hindu outfit, over a petty disagreement. Police have booked six people for attempted murder, and the situation is now under control.

title: Paytm shares fall 10%! Here's why One97 Communications stock is trading in red
content: Paytm shares tumbled nearly 10% amid speculation about the future of the Payment Infrastructure Development Fund (PIDF) scheme, which reportedly contributes significantly to its operating profit. The company clarified its recognition of PIDF incentives and its strategy to offset potential impacts. Meanwhile, Investec initiated coverage with a 'Buy' rating, citing strong fundamentals.

title: 22 more fall ill after drinking water in Indore, develop jaundice symptoms
content: At least two dozen Mhow residents, primarily children, have fallen ill with jaundice after allegedly consuming contaminated water. Indore Collector Shivam Verma visited the affected areas, directing immediate water quality checks and sanitation improvements. Health teams are conducting door-to-door surveys, ensuring timely treatment for all, with no critical cases reported.

title: In 4 or 40 days: Location decides how fast your passport arrives; Kerala remains fastest
content: Passport issuance times in India vary significantly by region, with some areas like Goa and Kerala averaging just four to five working days, while others, such as Chhattisgarh's Raipur, can take up to 40 days. Even within states, disparities exist, with delays also noted in the crucial police verification stage, impacting overall applicant experience.

title: 'To expand like Gujarat': PM Modi's big prediction on BJP's rise in Kerala
content: Addressing a large BJP rally at the Putharikandam Maidan, PM Modi said the party’s rise in Kerala would mirror its early growth in Gujarat, where it began by winning control of a single city nearly four decades ago. He recalled that before 1987, the BJP was a marginal force in Gujarat and received little attention.

title: Rupee tumbles to new low! Currency falls to 91.99 against US dollar
content: The Indian Rupee strengthened today against the US Dollar. This rise follows a softening of tariff threats between the US and Europe. Traders noted improved investor sentiment. However, the Rupee still faces pressure from foreign fund outflows. Experts suggest a period of consolidation and possible recovery. The 92.00 level is a key resistance point.

title: ‘Going against assumptions’: Jasprit Bumrah celebrates 10 years as India’s pace phenomenon
content: Jasprit Bumrah celebrated a decade in international cricket, a journey marked by overcoming doubts and achieving remarkable success.  Since his 2016 debut, Bumrah has become India's premier fast bowler, amassing 486 wickets across formats. His exceptional Test record, particularly overseas, and Player of the Tournament award at the 2024 T20 World Cup highlight his enduring impact.

title: Tharoor not 'relevant'? Congress neta's big attack as Kerala MP skips key poll meet
content: Tharoor, ​​​who is reportedly unhappy after Rahul Gandhi did not meet him during his visit to Kochi, will instead attend the Kerala literature festival.  The controversy around Tharoor and his reported rift with the party erupted following a series of events that led to the experts connecting dots of the veteran leader's dissatisfaction with his current position in the grand old party.

title: Nifty50 goes below 25,100; BSE Sensex drops over 700 points - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: The Sensex began the session on a positive note, but dropped over 700 points in afternoon trade. At 2:19 PM, Nifty50 was trading at 25,064.55, down 225 points or 0.89%. BSE Sensex was at 81,549.19, down 758 points or 0.92%.

title: 'It is tough on the body': Chris Morris on injuries in South Africa's T20 World Cup camp
content: Chris Morris views SA20 as an ideal T20 World Cup build-up, praising competitive conditions and the rise of South African players. He lauded Kagiso Rabada’s return, highlighted the rise of Jordan Hermann and Nqobani Mokoena, and stressed the value of spinners alongside seamers. Morris also acknowledges injury challenges, SA20’s transformative impact, and the enduring importance of all-rounders in modern international cricket.

title: Complaint filed against Palaash over Rs 40 lakh cheating case
content: A 34-year-old actor and producer has approached the police in Maharashtra’s Sangli district, alleging that he was cheated of Rs 40 lakh by composer and filmmaker Palaash Muchhal. Police confirmed on Thursday that no First Information Report (FIR) has been registered so far in the matter.

title: Manipur: Meitei man visiting Kuki fiancée abducted, shot dead; attack caught on cam
content: A Meitei man visiting his Kuki fiancée in Churachandpur was abducted and shot dead on camera, sparking outrage and fresh tensions in Manipur. The victim, M Rishikanta, was found dead near Natjang village. The perpetrators' video message read "No Peace, No Popular Government." The case is now being handed over to the NIA for investigation.

title: 'Minor incident': Massive outrage after Karnataka MP downplays tourist rape-murder
content: Koppal MP K Rajashekhar Hitnal's description of a foreign tourist's rape and murder as a "minor incident" has ignited widespread outrage. Political leaders and the public condemned the remarks, deeming them irresponsible and a downplaying of a serious law and order issue that has impacted tourism. Despite a clarification, criticism persists, with demands for a full apology.

title: Exclusive | BCB writes another letter to ICC; seeks intervention of DRC
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has again written to the ICC seeking arbitration through its independent dispute resolution committee after the world body refused to shift their T20 World Cup matches from India. Citing security concerns, the BCB has maintained it will not travel unless matches are moved to Sri Lanka. The standoff, however, was triggered by Mustafizur Rahman’s removal from the IPL over security issues.

title: PM Modi says Tamil Nadu ready to bid farewell to ‘corrupt’ DMK; Stalin hits back
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the NDA's campaign in Tamil Nadu, asserting voters are ready to oust the "corrupt" DMK government. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin countered, accusing the NDA of betraying the state and highlighting pending demands, including financial aid and NEET exemption.

title: ‘Entirely my fault’: Abhimanyu Easwaran owns freak run-out that stunned Ranji match
content: Bengal captain Abhimanyu Easwaran accepted full blame for a shocking run-out during a Ranji Trophy match. Batting on 81, Easwaran walked out of his crease assuming a drinks break, only for the bowler to deflect a return shot onto the stumps. He called it his own mistake, ending a promising innings.

title: Congress, BJP continue to trade charges on ruckus during Karnataka Governor’s address
content: Ruling Congress seeks an apology from the Governor, and the BJP seeks suspension of members and a resolution condemning the ruckus.

title: Cough syrup smuggling: U.P. Police attaches assets worth ₹28.5 crore of key accused
content: According to police, the attached assets include two fixed deposit receipts worth ₹1,13,93,276 in Indian Bank's Sampurnanand Sanskrit University branch in Varanasi, while two other bank accounts with a balance of ₹6,89,607 were debit-frozen

title: India to become third largest space-tech economy by 2030: Report
content: The report estimates that by 2030 India’s space economy will touch $40 billion and expects the sector to grow at twice the pace of the global market

title: DMK sharpens women-centric pitch with booth-level mobilisation plan
content: Under the drive, scheduled from February 1 to March 8, booth-level agents, workers and committeements have been asked to keep close contact with voters, tracking access to welfare schemes and assessing voter sentiment

title: Illegal sand mining: Police step up surveillance along banks of Chaliyar river
content: Ward-level committees to be reconstituted as part of the attempts to track the movement of illegal operators in the area

title: 110 dead due to SIR in Bengal, says Mamata, blames EC and Centre
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee asks why FIRs should not be registered against Election Commission for the deaths; she says attempts are being made to alter history

title: Cash-for-query: Lokpal gets more time to decide on sanction to file chargesheet against Mahua Moitra
content: The period of disposal is extended by two months while observing that no further request for extension of time will be entertained, a Bench of Justices Anil Kshetarpal and Harish Vaidyanathan Shankar said.

title: Twenty20’s NDA entry puts Congress in a bind at Vadavucode-Puthencruz panchayat
content: The UDF in the panchayat finds itself in the unenviable position of effectively remaining in power with the backing of the NDA

title: Ooty arts college student to take part in Republic Day parade in Delhi
content: S. Dinesh Kumar, from Sulur in Coimbatore, is a third-year student pursuing a degree in Defence Studies at the college, the press release stated.

title: T.N. Assembly condoles deaths of soldiers in Jammu and Kashmir’s Doda
content: An Army vehicle had skidded off the road and plunged into a deep gorge, killing 10 soldiers and injuring 11 others

title: T.N. proposes Special Area Development Authority for places of historical, ecological importance
content: It has been proposed to establish a Special Area Development Authority for areas such as Mamallapuram and Kanniyakumari, considering their historical, ecological, and tourism importance

title: Nearly 300 households in Aizawl to get 24x7 drinking water supply soon
content: The ₹5.24 crore project, funded by the Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation-2 scheme, was unveiled by Public Health Engineering Minister Lalnilawma

title: Leopard involved in fatal attack on devotee at M. M. Hills captured by Karnataka Forest Department
content: Based on stripe pattern analysis and drone visuals, experts at the Tiger Cell in Aranya Bhavan, Bengaluru confirmed that the captured leopard was involved in the fatal attack

title: Youth Congress leaders protest against Karnataka Governor, urges President to recall him
content: The leaders alleged that the Governor, being the custodian of the Constitution, had acted against the Constitution

title: WEF to launch five new centres for Fourth Industrial Revolution, one in India
content: The Fourth Industrial Revolution Network is a platform for multi-stakeholder collaboration, bringing together public and private sectors to help ensure emerging technologies deliver benefits

title: T.N. government announces relaxations in norms for jallikattu organisers, participants
content: The State government has decided to do away with the online registration of participants for jallikattu, and registration will henceforth be handled by the respective district administrations

title: Shivamogga MP B.Y. Raghavendra criticizes Congress government for disturbance after speech by Governor in Karnataka legislature
content: Says State Government attempted to use the speech by the Governor to criticize the Centre, ‘which was unacceptable’

title: Major fire breaks out at godown storing plastic scrap in Dindigul
content: Fire and Rescue Services personnel rushed to the spot and began firefighting operations, but due to the highly inflammable nature of plastic materials, the flames could not be brought under control immediately

title: Bomb threats trigger panic at Ahmedabad schools, officials confirm all were hoaxes
content: The messages reportedly warned schools against hoisting the national flag on Republic Day and contained references to ‘Khalistan’

title: Shrimp farmers seek restriction on SPF broodstock import from South East Asia
content: Shrimp farmers are apprehensive about unknown pathogens in the broodstock in South East Asian countries

title: Heavy rain likely along north Tamil Nadu coast on January 24
content: Officials of the RMC said the wet weather conditions would last until January 26, bringing light to moderate rainfall to various parts of the State. Dry weather is expected to return over the State by January 27.

title: High Court order on bike taxis welcomed by aggregators, riders and commuters in Karnataka
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy said he would first go through the judgment before responding to the order

title: ‘Wasteland’ to biodiversity hotspot: Tracing the transformation of Bengaluru’s Hesaraghatta grassland
content: It was only in January 2025 that the Karnataka Cabinet approved the declaration of Greater Hesaraghatta Grasslands Conservation Reserve (GHGCR), comprising 5,678 acres.

title: Sabarimala gold loss cases: Court grants former TDB officer Murari Babu statutory bail
content: Kollam Vigilance Court Judge Mohit C.S. granted bail to Babu as 90 days had elapsed since his arrest, and SIT had failed to file chargesheets in the two cases

title: Jairam Ramesh files petition in Supreme Court challenging ex post facto environmental clearances
content: Last month, the Congress general secretary had urged the Supreme Court to take suo motu cognisance of three "urgent" environmental matters.

title: Issues surrounding Governor’s address | Explained
content: In the Constituent Assembly, while adopting the article dealing with Governors’ address to State legislature, it was understood that it would reflect the policy of elected council of ministers and not the Governor’s personal views

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly adopts resolution against various provisions of VB-G RAM G Act
content: The resolution, moved by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin the House, stated it must be guaranteed that the allocation for the scheme was no less than those made in the previous years under the MGNREGS

title: Union Minister Kishan Reddy unveils Deendayal Upadhyaya statue in Vijayawada
content: The event was attended by BJP national general secretary B.L. Santhosh who inaugurated a photo exhibition showcasing rare visuals from the 1965 Jana Sangh National Conference

title: Supreme Court orders unconditional apology from Jharkhand lawyer over viral spat with Judge
content: A Bench disposed of the petition, granting Mahesh Tiwari the liberty to file an unconditional apology before a five-Judge High Court Bench, which had issued a contempt notice against him in October last year

title: T.N. Animal Husbandry Minister may boycott TANUVAS convocation over Governor-govt. tussle
content: Sources said Minister Anitha Radhakrishnan would not share the platform with Governor R.N. Ravi, who is the Chancellor of the University

title: Chhattisgarh factory blast: Kiln sealed at steel plant after probe finds safety lapses
content: Workers were charred to death in the blast that occurred at Real Ispat and Power Ltd, in Bakulahi village on January 22, 2026 morning

title: Supreme Court issues fresh notices to Anil Ambani, Reliance ADA Group on PIL alleging banking, corporate fraud
content: The Bench Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi fixed the plea for hearing after 10 days

title: PM Modi pushes ‘double engine’ pitch in Kerala, but makes no big-ticket announcements
content: Modi accuses LDF govt of denying benefits of Centrally sponsored schemes, including Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana and PM SHRI for schools, to people of the State, says ‘this is Modi’s guarantee’ that those involved in Sabarimala gold case will be nabbed and punished if BJP comes to power in Kerala

title: Three to four people dying in West Bengal every day due to SIR anxiety: Mamata
content: "More than 110 people have already died; every day, three to four people are taking their own lives out of SIR anxiety," says West Bengal CM

title: Not being able to meet Bal Thackeray was more painful than quitting Shiv Sena: MNS chief Raj
content: “More than quitting the party, leaving Matoshri was more painful," Raj Thackeray said in a media report

title: As PM Modi visits Tamil Nadu, CM Stalin reminds him of pending approvals, funds
content: The Prime Minister, in his tweet, said: “I’ll be joining NDA leaders at the rally in Madhuranthakam later today [Friday]. Tamil Nadu has decided that it’s time to bid farewell to the corrupt DMK government.”

title: Developed Kerala is vital for dream of a developed India, says PM Modi
content: Modi flags off three new Amrit Bharat Express trains and one passenger train allotted for Kerala, along with launching various developmental projects in different sectors

title: More than 60 poachers arrested in joint operation by Jharkhand, two other States: Official
content: A senior official said the teams also recovered poisonous snake venom, deer and leopard skin, and around 60 kg of pangolin scales, besides three country-made firearms, during the drive

title: Seven Indian fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan Navy for alleged poaching
content: “The fishermen were arrested, and their two trawlers seized on January 20 off Kovilan, in the northern Jaffna peninsula,” says the Navy

title: Mumbai’s woman mayorship: Lottery system and controversy explained
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) objected to the placement of Mumbai in the open women category instead of the OBC, as the city’s last mayor was from the same category

title: Tiger roaming Beddanuru Reserve Forest in Eluru district suspected to be male: Forest officials
content: The big cat, which has travelled approximately 35-40 km into Andhra Pradesh, appears “calm and undisturbed”

title: Army pays tributes to 10 soldiers killed in road accident J&K’s Doda
content: The Army’s Jammu-based White Knight Corps described the incident as “unfortunate” and said the vehicle slipped off the road while navigating treacherous terrain in bad weather

title: Government approves wage revision of PSU general insurers, NABARD, RBI employees, pensioners
content: A total of 46,322 employees, 23,570 pensioners and 23,260 family pensioners will benefit from the wage revision, the Finance Ministry said

title: Former Kerala BJP chief K. Surendran acquitted in 2016 case over alleged threat to police officer
content: K.Surendran’s acquittal comes after he was booked in a 2016 case for issuing threats against then Kannur Dy SP P.P Sadanandan in a Facebook post

title: KTR appears before SIT in phone-tapping probe
content: K.T. Rama Rao arrived before the probe team amidst heavy police deployment in connection with alleged phone tapping case.

title: PM Modi flags off four new trains in Kerala, launches SVANidhi Credit Card
content: As part of efforts to strengthen urban livelihood, PM SVANidhi Credit Card marks the next phase of financial inclusion for street vendors. Three Amrit Bharat trains among the new rail services launched

title: PM is India's greatest distorian: Congress recalls Vande Mataram row
content: Jairam Ramesh also alleged that the PM is "systematically demolishing" Mahatma Gandhi's memory and legacy, with the latest instance being the repeal of MGNREGA

title: What are the 33 questions in the first phase of Census 2027?
content: Census 2027 will also capture caste data electronically in the population enumeration phase, the government had said earlier.

title: Thirupparankundram row: Supreme Court issues notice in plea to direct ASI ‘takeover’ of temple
content: The petition filed by the Hindu Dharma Parishad sought the lighting of the Karthigai Deepam at a stone pillar, identified as the deepathoon, permanently for 24 hours daily

title: Anita Bose Pfaff asks Indians to support return of Netaji’s ashes to India
content: Netaji would have been deeply distressed that his remains are still kept outside his motherland more than 80 years after his death and 78 years after India became free, Anita Bose Pfaff wrote

title: Goa nightclub fire: ED conducts raids against Luthra brothers
content: The ED aims to probe the money-laundering angle linked to the illegal functioning of the club and the role of its promoters

title: Two Himanshu Bhau gang members held after encounter in Delhi
content: "When the police team attempted to stop the vehicle, Vicky opened fire at the personnel, prompting retaliatory action in which he sustained a bullet injury to his left leg," says a senior police officer

title: PM Modi arrives in Kerala capital, holds roadshow
content: This is Prime Minister’s first visit to State capital after BJP captured power in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation in recent local body elections

title: Over 20 private schools in Noida receive hoax bomb threat emails, security checks launched
content: Senior officers, personnel from various police stations, bomb disposal squads, fire services, dog squads and bomb detection and disposal squad (BDDS) teams were rushed to the affected schools

title: Bike taxis permitted by Karnataka High Court, State Government told to register them as transport vehicles
content: The HC has given liberty to the State Government to impose additional conditions for licence under the present rules for transport technology aggregators

title: Whale shark sighting off Visakhapatnam sparks fresh focus on marine conservation
content: The uncommon encounter by scuba divers in Visakhapatnam waters is prompting renewed attention on whale shark conservation, marine documentation and the fragile ecology of the Andhra coast

title: Scientific thought integral to Kannada literature since Adikavi Pampa: L. N. Mukundaraj
content: Karnataka Sahitya Academy President L. N. Mukundaraj was addressing a Science Literature and Communication Camp jointly organised by the Karnataka Science and Technology Academy and Karnataka Sahitya Academy

title: FIR against Gurpatwant Singh Pannun for threatening to create unrest in Delhi ahead of Republic Day
content: “The action was initiated after Pannun released a video message on social media in which he allegedly threatened to disturb peace and law and order in Delhi before the Republic Day celebrations on January 26” says police

title: FKCCI opposes power tariff hike as ESCOMs in Karnataka seek truing-up of revenue gap
content: The State’s five electricity supply companies (ESCOMs) have written to KERC about a mismatch between approved costs and actual expenditure

title: PM Modi pays tributes to Netaji Bose on birth anniversary
content: In a series of posts on X, Mr. Modi also listed out steps taken by his government to popularise Bose's ideals and slammed efforts by previous governments to forget his contribution to the nation

title: Sikkim disaster management authority, Lieutenant Col. Seeta Ashok Shelke to get Subhash Chandra Bose Aapda Prabandhan Puraskar 2026
content: Subhash Chandra Bose Aapda Prabandhan Puraskar is to recognise and honour invaluable contribution and selfless service rendered by individuals and organisations in the field of disaster management

title: Basant Panchami puja begins at Bhojshala site amid tight security in M.P.’s Dhar
content: As many as 8,000 security personnel, including district police, Rapid Action Force, CRPF, MP Armed Force, SRPF and women police units, have been deployed around the site

title: Srinagar receives season’s first snowfall, all flights cancelled for the day
content: Srinagar-Jammu national highway closed; Mata Vaishno Devi shrine also witnessed first snowfall of the season, forcing the authorities to suspend the yatra

title: Nine fall ill due to water contamination in Madhya Pradesh’s Mhow
content: Cases of water-borne diseases were reported from the Patti Bazaar and Chander Marg areas on Thursday (January 22, 2026) night, officials said

title: Tribals’ long march suspended after government accepts demands
content: Palghar District Collector Dr. Indu Rani Jakhar told The Hindu that the administration took review of the several concerns raised by the delegation

title: Rain lashes parts of Delhi, Punjab, Haryana; minimum temperatures rise above normal
content: IMD has predicted thunderstorms accompanied by rain over Delhi and adjoining regions for the day due to an ongoing western disturbance

title: Fadnavis refutes allegations of domestic MoUs being signed at Davos
content: Circular economy for Mumbai, India’s first Innovation city in the State, were some of the key announcements

title: Gujarat delegation holds over 30 global investor meetings at WEF 2026
content: Gujarat’s first delegation is engaging at the WEF to boost international collaboration, attract global investments, and advance its Viksit Gujarat@2047 development vision

title: Written 26 poems already on SIR: Mamata while inaugurating Kolkata Book Fair
content: Accuses Election Commission of harassing people over birth dates; says even Vajpayee was not born on December 25

title: The human cost behind every delivery
content: The Union government’s directive to quick-commerce platforms to drop the concept of 10-minute deliveries owing to the excessive stress it puts delivery personnel under has been welcomed by gig workers, but they say it is just the tip of the iceberg. Low pay, inadequate incentives, poor safety measures and mistreatment at work all threaten their livelihoods, writes Harish Gilai

title: 44 years on, closed dye factory’s contaminating colours still remain underground in Kochi
content: The unit produced Rhodamine-B, a fluorescent dye used mostly in textile, leather and cosmetics industries

title: Hesaraghatta Grassland: Is the grass greener with the new tag?
content: A year after the Hesaraghatta Grasslands got the conservation reserve tag, K.C. Deepika visits the area to see if there has been a transformation from ‘wasteland’ to a biodiversity hotspot

title: Auroral activity captured at Hanle by IIA’s all-sky camera
content: This is the sixth time during the current solar cycle that the intense red coloured auroral activity was captured by the all-sky camera

title: The Ponzi playbook in Telangana: built on trust, broken by fraud
content: Promising high returns and low risk, Ponzi schemes are quietly draining household savings across Telangana and beyond. Behind polished apps, corporate facades and reassuring payouts lies a carefully engineered cycle of trust, timing and collapse. Lavpreet Kaur examines how such frauds flourish amid regulatory gaps

title: Ravens hiring Bolts' Minter as new head coach
content: The Ravens are hiring Los Angeles Chargers defensive coordinator Jesse Minter as their next head coach, the team announced Thursday.

title: LeBron brushes off Buss report: 'Don't really care'
content: LeBron James said he wasn't bothered by an ESPN story this week that detailed his allegedly strained relationship with Lakers team governor Jeanie Buss, saying, "I don't care about how somebody feels about me."

title: Colts confirm FBI opened probe into Irsay's death
content: The Indianapolis Colts on Thursday acknowledged the existence of an FBI investigation into the death of owner Jim Irsay and the potential involvement of a California doctor who reportedly prescribed him pain pills and ketamine.

title: Kuminga injures knee, ankle; holding off on MRI
content: The Warriors' Jonathan Kuminga told ESPN he will wait to see how his hyperextended knee feels Friday morning before deciding whether to get an MRI.

title: Golden on Bediako return: 'We'll beat 'em anyways'
content: Florida coach Todd Golden said Thursday that he doesn't agree that Charles Bediako should be able to play for Alabama but doesn't think it will matter if he does when the teams play Feb. 1.

title: 'We're back': No. 16 Sooners stun Gamecocks
content: Aaliyah Chavez scored 15 of her 26 points in overtime, and No. 16 Oklahoma stunned No. 2 South Carolina 94-82 on Thursday night.

title: Alcaraz stays sharp, sweeps past game Moutet
content: Corentin Moutet kept Carlos Alcaraz on his toes with a variety of shots, but the 22-year-old cruised to a 6-2, 6-4, 6-1 win in their third-round Australian Open match.

title: Rodman contract saga ends with record Spirit deal
content: United States forward Trinity Rodman signed a record three-year contract with the Washington Spirit on Thursday to remain at the club, ending months-long uncertainty over the star's future.

title: 🏀 Cooper? Kon? Who is the NBA's No. 1 rookie?

title: "Isn't That...?" Family Found Out About Meitei Man's Murder Through Video
content: The family of Mayanglambam Rishikanta Singh didn't know he had been staying in Manipur's Churachandpur district with his wife, a woman from the Kuki tribes, until the horrific viral video surfaced on social media, his family members said.

title: Bangladesh Planning New Barrage On Padma River As Farrakka Talks Stall
content: The India-Bangladesh Farrakka Water Treaty talks between India and Bangladesh have made little headway as it comes up for renewal this year.

title: Hypersonic Speed, 1,500 Km Range: DRDO's Missile To Debut On Republic Day
content: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) will unveil its long-range Anti-Ship Hypersonic Glide Missile (LRAShM) at the 77th Republic Day Parade on Kartavya Path on January 26.

title: Inside Life in Uniform: NDTV's Jai Jawan Features Actor Bhumi Pednekar In Republic Day Special
content: On Republic Day, as the nation reflects on freedom and duty, NDTV's iconic programme Jai Jawan will bring viewers closer to the men and women who do that duty every day.

title: Masseuse Accused Of Assaulting Mumbai Woman Over Booking Cancellation. Video Viral
content: A woman in Mumbai has accused an Urban Company masseuse of assault, pulling her hair, and punching her in the face. I

title: Video: Boy Sitting On Balcony Grill Of Ghaziabad High-Rise Sparks Concern
content: A shocking video from Indirapuram, Ghaziabad, has gone viral, showing a young child sitting on the outer edge of a balcony grill in a high-rise building, several floors above the ground.

title: PM Modi Invokes J Jayalalithaa In Tamil Nadu Rally, Says DMK's Time Is Up
content: Setting the stage for a high-stakes battle for the Tamil Nadu Assembly election, Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a large gathering at Maduranthakam near Chennai and declared that the countdown for the DMK's exit has begun.

title: Opinion: Opinion: The Iran Regime May Survive, But It Has Lost Something Big
content: All revolutions have heroes: real and imaginary, rising from the ground and foisted from above, fallible and flawless. Successful revolutions, however, succeed without and despite these heroes.

title: Opinion: Opinion: Trump's Greenland Fixation Exposes NATO's Faultlines
content: Many critics of NATO argue that it has outlived much of its original utility because it was designed for a world that no longer exists.

title: "Miya Biwi Raazi": Rajasthan Court On Muslim Couple's Divorce By Consent
content: The Rajasthan High Court held the divorce of a Muslim couple by mutual consent fully valid, overturning a family court's order wherein the wife's petition had been dismissed.

title: "Unjust" In 2020, Ok In 2026: Pak PM Slammed For Trump's Gaza Plan U-Turn
content: US President Donald Trump launched the "Board of Peace" at the World Economic Forum in the Swiss resort of Davos on January 22.

title: Sri Lankan Man Lets Another Fly To London Using His Ticket, Arrested In Bengaluru
content: A Sri Lankan passenger was arrested at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport over an alleged fraud in which he let another person travel to London using his boarding pass and UK visa.

title: 'Haven't Even Spoken About Tariffs': Rahul Gandhi's 'Dead Economy' Jab At Centre
content: Taking aim at the Centre and Narendra Modi over what he termed a "dead economy", Leader of the Opposition and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi alleged tariffs are hurting textile exporters, but the Prime Minister has not even spoken about the issue.

title: Rupee Falls To Record Low Of 92 Against US Dollar, Settles At 91.88
content: The rupee hit an all-time low of 92 on Friday and recovered marginally to settle at 91.88 (provisional) against the American currency, amid selling pressure from foreign funds and risk-off sentiment in global markets.

title: 9 Maoists, Carrying Total Bounty Of Rs 47 Lakh, Surrender In Chhattisgarh
content: Nine Maoists carrying a cumulative reward of Rs 47 lakh surrendered before police in Chhattisgarh's Dhamtari district on Friday, a senior official said.

title: 2 Murder Convicts Fall In Love In Jail. They Get Parole To Get Married
content: A woman convicted of murdering a man she met on a dating app and a man who killed five people are set to tie the knot in Rajasthan's Alwar, in what appears to be right out of a film script.

title: 'No Nuclear Threat During Operation Sindoor': Nuclear Watchdog Chief To NDTV
content: The head of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), Rafael Mariano Grossi, has stated that there was no indication of any involvement of nuclear weapons during the India-Pakistan conflict in 2025.

title: Old Tax Vs New Tax Regime: What Budget 2026 May Change For India's Salaried Class
content: Government data shows this strategy is already working. For FY 2023-24, 72% of taxpayers, around 5.27 crore, chose the new tax regime.

title: 'Heated Rivalry' stars named torchbearers for Milan Cortina Olympics
content: MILAN -- The actors co-starring in the hit hockey romance TV series "Heated Rivalry" are set to be among the torchbearers carrying the Olympic flame on the way to the Opening Ceremony for the Milan Cortina Games. The organizing committee announced Thursday that Hudson Williams and Connor Storrie will take part in the torch relay. The Opening Ceremony is scheduled for Feb. 6. The series based on the "Game Changers" books has captivated viewers with the fictional story of a Canadian player and a Russian rival sustaining a decade-long secret relationship. The first season became the No. 1 series on HBO Max. Originally developed for the Canadian streaming service Crave, the show scored a distribution deal with HBO and has been renewed for a second season. It will broadcast in Italy beginning next month.
